titlestmt.subtitle: A Finding Aid to the Collection in the Library of Congress
titlestmt.author: Prepared by Audrey M. Cahill, W. Roberts, and A. Thompson

controlnote.p: Converted to EAD3 : Encoded Archival Description (EAD), Version 3 : Release: 1.1.1 : Release Date: 2019-12-16. Validating against latest version of schema.

maintenanceevent.eventdescription: Converted from EAD 2002 to EAD 3 (Release 1.1.1) by ead3_converter_mfer.xsl : Michael Ferrando, Library of Congress.
Finding aid encoded by Library of Congress Manuscript Division

did.head: Collection Summary
did.abstract: Geographer, inventor, and cartographer. Correspondence, writings, subject files, research data, printed matter, and other material relating mainly to Boggs's geographic studies and to his inventions and research interests.

controlaccess.head: Selected Search Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the LC Catalog. They are grouped by name of person or organization, by subject or location, and by occupation and listed alphabetically.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The papers of Samuel Whittemore Boggs, geographer, inventor and cartographer, were given to the Library of Congress by his wife in 1955, with an additional gift of Dorothy C. Novak, professional associate of Boggs, in 1967.

processinfo.head: Processing History
processinfo.p: The collection was processed in 1956 and expanded in 1985. The finding aid was revised in 2012.

otherfindaid.head: Additional Guides
otherfindaid.p: A note on these papers appeared in the Library of Congress Information Bulletin (April 30, 1956).

userestrict.head: Copyright Status
userestrict.p: Copyright in the unpublished writings of Samuel Whittemore Boggs in the collections of papers in the Library of Congress is dedicated to the public.

accessrestrict.head: Access and Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: The papers of Samuel Boggs are open to research. Researchers are advised to contact the Manuscript Reading Room prior to visiting. Many collections are stored off-site and advance notice is needed to retrieve these items for research use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Researchers wishing to cite this collection should include the following information: Container number, Samuel Whittemore Boggs Papers, Manuscript Division, Library of Congress, Washington, D.C.

chronitem.event: Private secretary to president, Berea College, Berea, Ky.
Student, Yale Divinity School, Yale University, New Haven, Conn.
Secretarial work, Union Pacific Railroad, Omaha, Neb.
Secretarial and executive work for International Committee of YMCA and other organizations, New York
Geographical research, map compilation, editor, American Book Co., including maps for World Missionary Atlas , 1921-1924
M.A. in geography, Columbia University, New York, N.Y.
Lecturer, Columbia University, New York, N.Y.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p:
The papers of Samuel Whittemore Boggs (1889-1954) span the years 1912-1954. Consisting of correspondence, drafts of articles, notes, maps, printed matter, and clippings, the collection focuses on Boggs's diverse geographical interests. Included are files of geographic data on various regions of the world, reports of missionary activity, material relating to Boggs's mapping inventions, files for proposed studies, and preparatory materials for his lectures, speeches, and publications. The collection is organized into seven series:
Correspondence ,
Professional File ,
Writings File ,
Lectures ,
Subject File ,
Miscellany , and
Oversize .

Topics of significance include boundary delimitation, regionalism, global relations, and water boundaries. Featured are Boggs's pioneering work as inventor of an eumorphic equal-area map projection, graphic traffic signals, and a universal graphic charting instrument. Also in the papers are notes on courses given at Columbia University.

Boggs's filing system was retained in parts of the collection, including a "Regions of the World" section in the
Subject File series. A guide to the section is in the first folder of the material.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Papers
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged in seven series:

scopecontent.p: Special correspondence of letters to and from Boggs as geographer with the State Department and general correspondence.

arrangement.p: Arranged alphabetically within the two groups.

scopecontent.p: Material related to professional projects during the various phases of Boggs's career.
